reviewText:
Catorize
This key was given to me for reviewing purposes, this however does not affect the review in any way because I review games of my choice.

About the game
This game is about the life of a box cat, he soars through the air using his tail to devour all the jellybeans he can find. Become a jumping cat that magically transforms into a perfect square when it jumps and jump around the map in search of jellybeans. You must travel the area while dodging enemies and obstacles while you eat all the jellybeans you get your paws on.

Is this game worth it?
This is a great and affordable platformer, it is meant for casual and hardcore platformers. It is pretty easy and simple making it quite fun for people not to serious about it. It also can be very challenging trying to achieve 3 stars on each and every level and be quite a fun challenge. This game has quite a few hours of gameplay in it and is very affordable, I recommend this to each and every platform gamer.

Pros Cats!
JellyBeans!
Flying cats!
Cat turns into a flying box.
Use your tail to fly high in the air in search of jellybeans.
Hard, yet fun platformer.
Lots of levels.

Cons
Cant customize your cat.
Levels can be really easy.
Cant fullscreen the game.
Tiny Levels.

Final Verdict
I rate this platformer a 7.6/10, I am not a big fan of platformers but this one was quite enjoyable. I found it very relaxing making my cat chase after jellybeans. I only wish that there was customization for your cat(would love a tophat and monacle for my cat).

If you liked this review and would like to see more please follow our curation group Here

reviewText:
Overall, I'm not that impressed with this game (as it is.)

The difficulty spike is ENORMOUS!!!
In the first one or two levels, you're just starting to get a hang of the controls, And then the game introduces obstacles like 'wind' which, when you're not used to the controls, makes it exceedingly frustrating to play and get 3 stars.

The controls.
Logical to use the mouse for general aim and fire but the aim, I thought was a bit difficult to use sometimes. The other thing was trying to use the aim and power IN MIDAIR was very fiddly and difficult to get right.

All in all, I think this game needs a bit more polish and could be a great game. It's still a decent enough game but it won't hold your attention for too long. The only reason why I tried this game out was because A.) it had a cat as its main character (albeit no real story or explanation for it) B.) it was $2.50 (if I had paid more, then I'd be quite upset) and C.) It's an indie title and you should at least TRY and give the smaller guys (or girls) a try and a helping hand.

I hope there will be further updates such as the way to control and move around the screen, which would definitely improve at least the playability of this game.

You have to use your square cat creature to fling from one platform to another to get the different gems. You fling it by dragging the mouse in the opposite direction, which took me a moment to figure out as there were no real instructions. The fewer moves you do it in, the more stars you get (from 1-3). That is pretty much it. If you enjoy this type of puzzle platformer, it may be for you, but I found it a bit boring and repetitive. The game also crashed on me when I went to scroll from one screen to the next on the puzzle selection screen.\n\nA bit to dull for me: 4/10.

reviewText: Catorize seems incredibly difficult at first, but when you realise you can make the cat float by constantly clicking and dragging, it becomes incredibly easy. Boringly easy...
NO. Playing this with mouse is a nightmare, impossible to get three stars - even on first level.\n\nAlso, the game likes to crash regularly.
